js
Class Field<T>

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      js.Var<T>
          js.Field<T>

public final class Field<T>
extends Var<T>

An opaque class helping to simulate the JavaScript's late-evaluation feature of object fields.

This opaque class is especially helpful when used together with the opaque class Static to make Java static final references to the fields of JavaScript global objects which requires late-evaluation and refresh-on-reload in JS applets or other JS Embed Simulations.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
Static
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects.

Constructor Detail

Field

public Field(Var<? extends JsObject> q,
             Var.Member<?> m)

Creates a late-evaluation field with an opaque qualifier.

Parameters:
q - The opaque qualifier for the field
m - The opaque member for the field
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert this constructor into the JavaScript expression: 
q.m
where m must be resolved to the field identifier at re-compile time.

Field

public Field(Var.Member<?> m)

Creates a late-evaluation global field.

Parameters:
m - The opaque member for the global field
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert this constructor into the JavaScript expression: 
m
where m m must be resolved to the field identifier at re-compile time.
Method Detail

var

public T var()

Evaluates the field.

Specified by:
var in class Var<T>
Returns:
The value of the current instance itself.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must ignore the virtual invocation of this method, that is, replacing it with its current instance.
